app-launcher.description:
The App Launcher allows the user to quickly access all the apps and functionality with their organization.
The App Launcher should generally only be used as a sub-component of the [Global Navigation Bar](/components/global-navigation-bar)

Also note: App Launcher is not included in the standard component export. To import it, you must reference it directly via its path.
Example:
```
import AppLauncher from 'design-system-react/components/app-launcher';
import AppLauncherTile from 'design-system-react/components/app-launcher/tile';
import AppLauncherSection from 'design-system-react/components/app-launcher/section';
```

USAGE EXAMPLE:
```
<AppLauncher>
	<AppLauncherSection>
		<AppLauncherTile />
		<AppLauncherTile />
		<AppLauncherTile />
	</AppLauncherSection>
	<AppLauncherSection>
		<AppLauncherTile />
		<AppLauncherTile />
	</AppLauncherSection>
</AppLauncher>
```

By default, `Modal`, a child component of App Launcher, will add `aria-hidden=true` to the `body` tag, but this disables some assistive technologies. To prevent this you can add the following to your application with `#mount` being the root node of your application that you would like to hide from assistive technologies when the `Modal` is open.
```
import settings from 'design-system-react/components/settings';
settings.setAppElement('#mount');
```

children.description: One or more `<AppLauncherSection />`s each containing one or more `<AppLauncherTile />`s

isOpen.description: Control the open/close state of the App Launcher

modalClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to App Launcher Modal.

modalHeaderButton.description: Button that exists in the upper right hand corner of the App Launcher modal

noTruncate.description: Allows longer application names without truncating them.

onClose.description: Callback when the App Launcher Modal is closed

search.description: Search bar for the Modal's header. Will typically be an instance of `design-system-react/forms/input/search`

title.description: Set the App Launcher's title text (for localization)

triggerAssistiveText.description: Assistive text for app launcher icon

triggerName.description: This is typically the name of the cloud or application

triggerOnClick.description: Callback when the App Launcher icon is clicked

section.description: App Launcher Sections allow users to categorize App Tiles as well as toggle their display

title.description: The title for this section of apps

toggleable.description: Allows the user to show/hide the section

collapseSectionAssistiveText.description: The assistive text for the section collapse icons

children.description: An array of applications to display

isOpen.description: Controls the open/closed state of the section

onToggleClick.description: Callback for when section is toggled. Passes "isOpen" bool. Forces `toggleable` to true

section.name: section

tile.description: App Launcher Tiles provide information and links to a user's apps

title.description: App name for the tile's title.

description.description: The description of the app. Not visible on small tiles.

href.description: The `href` attribute of the tile. Please pass in bookmarkable URLs from your routing library. If the `onClick` callback is specified this URL will be prevented from changing the browser's location.

moreLabel.description: The localized text for the "More information" tooltip.

className.description: Class names to be added to the tile.

onClick.description: Function that will be executed when clicking on a tile

iconNode.description: Icon node for app tile. Takes priority over `iconText`

iconText.description: Text to be used as an icon. Only renders if iconNode is undefined

search.description: Text used to highlight content in app tiles

tile.name: tile

breadcrumb.description: Use breadcrumbs to note the path of a record and help the user to navigate back to the parent.Breadcrumb based on SLDS 2.1.0-dev

assistiveText.description: The assistive text for the breadcrumb trail

trail.description: An array of react elements presumably anchor elements.

button.description: The Button component is the Lightning Design System Button component. The Button should be used for label buttons, icon buttons, or buttons that have both labels and icons. Either a label or assistiveText is required; see the Prop Details table below. For buttons that maintain selected/unselected states, use the ButtonStateful component.

aria-describedby.description: Used if the Button triggers a tooltip. The value should match the `id` of the element with `role="tooltip"`.

aria-expanded.description: Used if the Button triggers a menu or popup. Bool indicates if the menu or popup is open or closed.

aria-haspopup.description: True if Button triggers a menu or popup to open/close.

assistiveText.description: Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means. If the button has an icon and a visible label, you can omit the assistiveText prop and use the label prop.

buttonRef.description: Callback that passes in the DOM reference of the `<button>` DOM node within this component. Primary use is to allow `focus` to be called. You should still test if the node exists, since rendering is asynchronous. `buttonRef={(component) => { if(component) console.log(component); }}`

className.description: CSS classes to be added to button.

disabled.description: Disables the button and adds disabled styling.

hint.description: Associates an icon button with another element on the page by changes the color of the SVG. Please reference Lightning Design System Buttons > Hint.

iconCategory.description: Name of the icon category. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon categories.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

iconPath.description: Path to the icon. This will override any global icon settings.

iconPosition.description: If omitted, icon position is centered.

iconSize.description: Determines the size of the icon.

iconVariant.description: For icon variants, please reference Lightning Design System Icons.

id.description: Id string applied to button node.

inverse.description: If true, button/icon is white. Meant for buttons or utility icons on dark backgrounds.

label.description: Visible label on the button. If the button is an icon button with no label, you must use the assistiveText prop.

onClick.description: Triggered when the button is clicked.

responsive.description: If true, button scales to 100% width on small form factors.

tabIndex.description: Write "-1" if you don't want the user to tab to the button.

button-stateful.description: The ButtonStateful component is a variant of the Lightning Design System Button component. It is used for buttons that have a state of unselected or selected. For icon buttons, use variant='icon'. For buttons with labels or buttons with labels and icons, pass data to the state props (ie. stateOne={{iconName: 'add', label: 'Join'}}).

active.description: Specifies the current state of the button. If set, the button will act as a ['controlled' component](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/forms.html#controlled-components).

assistiveText.description: Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means. This should also include the state of the button. If the button has an icon and a visible label, you can omit the assistiveText prop and use the label prop.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

inverse.description: If true, button/icon is white. Meant for buttons or utility icons on dark backgrounds.

responsive.description: If true, button scales to 100% width on small form factors.

stateOne.description: Initial label and icon (optional) of button.

stateTwo.description: Selected label and icon (optional) of button.

stateThree.description: Deselect label and icon (optional) of button.

tabIndex.description: Write "-1" if you don't want the user to tab to the button.

button-group.description: The ButtonGroup component wraps other components (ie. Button, MenuDropdown, PopoverTooltip, Checkboxes, etc).

children.description: Children are expected to be components. If last button triggers a dropdown menu, use Dropdown instead of Button. _Tested with snapshot testing._

className.description: CSS classes added to `slds-button-group` or `slds-checkbox--button-group` tag

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `error`: Message to display when any of Checkboxes are in an error state. _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `label`: This label appears above the button group. _Tested with snapshot testing._

variant.description: Use checkbox variant for "Checkbox Button Group" styling and add Checkbox components as children _Tested with snapshot testing._

card.description: Cards are used to apply a container around a related grouping of information. It has a header, a body, and an optional footer. It often contains a DataTable or Tile (coming soon). Actions associated with selected items or with all items are included within the header actions. Footer often contains pagination.

bodyClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to the card body (wraps children).

children.description: The main section of the card. It often contains a `DataTable` or `Tile`.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the card.

empty.description: Replaces the body (that is the children) with the specified empty state, this will also remove header actions, the filter, and the icon. If the default empty state is wanted, set to `true`.

filter.description: Adds a filter input to the card header.

header.description: Allows a custom header (the media object with the icon in the first column). `icon`, `heading` and other props are passed into the media object from Card if present. Use `design-system-react/components/media-object` to create your own custom header.

heading.description: The heading is the name of the related item group and should only contain inline elements.

headerActions.description: Actions to perform on selected items or actions that are not specific to one item such as adding an item. If no group actions are needed, then the number of selected items is often present.

icon.description: Icon associated with the items within the `body`.

id.description: Set the HTML `id` of the card. This also sets the `id` of the filter and the header actions.

style.description: Custom styles to be added to the card.

empty.description: A default empty state for Cards.

children.description: Additional call to actions that will render under the heading. Often this is an "Add Item" button.

heading.description: Primary text for an Empty Card.

empty.name: empty

filter.description: A default filter or search input for Cards that contain items.

id.description: The HTML `id` from the card with a suffixe.

onChange.description: This callback fires when the input changes.

placeholder.description: Text present in input until the user enters text. This text will also be used for a visually hidden label on the filter `input` element for accessibility.

filter.name: filter

checkbox.description: The ability to style checkboxes with CSS varies across browsers. Using this component ensures checkboxes look the same everywhere.

assistiveText.description: Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the Checkbox is for. If the Checkbox has a visible label, you can omit the assistiveText prop and use the label prop.

checked.description: The Checkbox is a controlled component, and will always be in this state. If checked is not defined, the state of the uncontrolled native `input` component will be used.

className.description: Class names to be added to the outer container of the Checkbox.

disabled.description: Disables the Checkbox and prevents clicking it.

errorText.description: Message to display when the Checkbox is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support. This ID is added to the `input` element

indeterminate.description: The Checkbox will be indeterminate if its state can not be figured out or is partially checked. Once a checkbox is indeterminate, a click should cause it to be checked. Since a user cannot put a checkbox into an indeterminate state, it is assumed you are controlling the value of `checked` with the parent, also, and that this is a controlled component. **Note:** `indeterminate` proptype does nothing in the `toggle` variant, as [SLDS does not support it](https://lightningdesignsystem.com/components/forms/#flavor-checkbox-toggle-checkbox-toggle).

label.description: An optional label for the Checkbox.

labelToggleEnabled.description: Label for the _enabled_ state of the Toggle variant. Defaults to "Enabled".

labelToggleDisabled.description: Label for the _disabled_ state of the Toggle variant. Defaults to "Disabled". Note that this uses SLDS language, and meaning, of "Enabled" and "Disabled"; referring to the state of whatever the checkbox is _toggling_, not whether the checkbox itself is enabled or disabled.

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

onBlur.description: This event fires when the Checkbox focused is blurred.

onChange.description: This event fires when the Checkbox changes.

onFocus.description: This event fires when the Checkbox is focused.

onKeyDown.description: This event fires when a key is pressed down.

onKeyPress.description: This event fires when a character is typed. Probably.  See [this article](http://www.bloggingdeveloper.com/post/KeyPress-KeyDown-KeyUp-The-Difference-Between-Javascript-Key-Events.aspx) for more information.

onKeyUp.description: This event fires when a pressed key is released.

readOnly.description: Displays the value of the input, but does not allow changes.

required.description: Highlights the Checkbox as a required field (does not perform any validation).

variant.description: Which flavor of checkbox? Default is `base` while other option is `toggle`. (**Note:** `toggle` variant does not support the `indeterminate` feature, because [SLDS does not support it](https://lightningdesignsystem.com/components/forms/#flavor-checkbox-toggle-checkbox-toggle).)

data-table.description: DataTables support the display of structured data in rows and columns with an HTML table. To sort, filter or paginate the table, simply update the data passed in the items to the table and it will re-render itself appropriately. The table will throw a sort event as needed, and helper components for paging and filtering are coming soon.

assistiveTextForActionsHeader.description: Text for heading of actions column

assistiveTextForColumnSort.description: Text for sort action on table column header

assistiveTextForColumnSortedAscending.description: Text announced once a column is sorted in ascending order

assistiveTextForColumnSortedDescending.description: Text announced once a column is sorted in descending order

assistiveTextForSelectAllRows.description: Text for select all checkbox within the table header

children.description: Provide children of the type `` to define the structure of the data being represented and children of the type `` to define a menu which will be rendered for each item in the grid. Use a _higher-order component_ to customize a data table cell that will override the default cell rendering. `CustomDataTableCell` must have the same `displayName` as `DataTableCell` or it will be ignored. If you want complete control of the HTML, including the wrapping `td`, you don't have to use `DataTableCell`. ``` import DataTableCell from 'design-system-react/data-table/cell'; const CustomDataTableCell = ({ children, ...props }) => ( {children} ); CustomDataTableCell.displayName = DataTableCell.displayName; ```

className.description: Class names to be added to the table.

columnBordered.description: A variant which adds border to the vertical columns.

compact.description: A variant which decreases padding and allows more items and columns to be viewed.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support.

fixedLayout.description: Use this if you are creating an advanced table (selectable, sortable, or resizable rows)

items.description: The collection of items to render in the table.

noRowHover.description: A variant which removes hover style on rows

onChange.description: This function fires when the selection of rows changes.

onSort.description: This function fires when the table should be sorted.

selectRows.description: True if rows should be selectable.

stacked.description: A variant which modifies table layout by stacking cells to accommodate smaller viewports. Should not be used at the same time as `stackedHorizontal`.

stackedHorizontal.description: A variant which modifies table layout by displaying the header and row data side by side for smaller viewports. Should not be used at the same time as `stacked`.

striped.description: A variant which adds stripes to alternating rows.

unborderedRow.description: Tables have horizontal borders by default. This removes them.

unbufferedCell.description: A variant which removes horizontal padding. CSS class will be removed if `fixedLayout==true`.

cell.description: The default Cell renderer for the DataTable. Pass in any React component with the same `displayName` which takes the same props to provide custom rendering.

children.description: The contents of the cell. This can be simple text or DOM nodes. Equivalent to `props.item[props.property]`

className.description: Class names to be added to the cell.

fixedLayout.description: Use this if you are creating an advanced table (selectable, sortable, or resizable rows)

item.description: The item from the items which represents this row.

primaryColumn.description: The primary column for a row. This is almost always the first column.

property.description: The property of this item to display.

title.description: Shows on hover. Useful for truncated cells.

width.description: Width of column. This is required for advanced/fixed layout tables. Please provide units. (`rems` are recommended)

cell.name: cell

column.description: Columns define the structure of the data displayed in the DataTable.

children.description: Use a _higher-order component_ to customize a data table cell that will override the default cell rendering. `CustomDataTableCell` must have the same `displayName` as `DataTableCell` or it will be ignored. If you want complete control of the HTML, including the wrapping `td`, you don't have to use `DataTableCell`. ``` import DataTableCell from 'design-system-react/data-table/cell'; const CustomDataTableCell = ({ children, ...props }) => ( {children} ); CustomDataTableCell.displayName = DataTableCell.displayName; ```

label.description: The column label. If a `string` is not passed in, no `title` attribute will be rendered.

primaryColumn.description: The primary column for a row. This is almost always the first column.

property.description: The property which corresponds to this column.

sortable.description: Whether or not the column is sortable.

sortDirection.description: The current sort direction. If left out the component will track this internally.

title.description: Title used for truncation div within the cell.

width.description: Width of column. This is required for advanced/fixed layout tables. Please provide units. (`rems` are recommended)

column.name: column

highlight-cell.description: A Cell renderer for the DataTable that automatically highlights search text.

children.description: The contents of the cell. Equivalent to `props.item[props.property]`

search.description: The string of text (or Regular Expression) to highlight.

highlight-cell.name: highlight-cell

row-actions.description: RowActions provide a mechanism for defining a menu to display alongside each row in the DataTable.

assistiveText.description: Description of the menu for screenreaders.

className.description: Class names to be added to the actions menu.

row-actions.name: row-actions

date-picker.description:
A date picker is a non text input form element. You can select a single date from a popup or inline calendar. The date picker supplied by this library comes with an input by default, but other components could be passed in as children--however, pairing with other components is untested.

The calendar is rendered with time/dates based on local browser time of the client. All dates are in local user timezones. Another way to put it is if a user selects a date, they are selecting midnight their time on that day and not mightnight in UTC. If this component is being used in conjuction with a timezone input, you may want to convert dates provided to UTC in that timezone.

This component is wrapped in a [higher order component to listen for clicks outside itself](https://github.com/kentor/react-click-outside) and thus requires use of `ReactDOM`.

This component may use a portalMount (a disconnected React subtree mount) within an absolutely positioned DOM node created with [Drop](http://github.hubspot.com/drop/).

type.name: custom

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `nextMonth`: Label for button to go to the next month _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `openCalendar`: Call to action label for calendar dialog trigger _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `previousMonth`: Label for button to go to the previous month _Tested with snapshot testing._

align.description: Aligns the right or left side of the menu with the respective side of the trigger. _Tested with snapshot testing._

children.description: Pass in an `<Input />` component to customize it. Event handlers for the input (if needed) should be added here and not to this component. `<Input onKeyDown... />`.` _Tested with Mocha framework._

className.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `slds-datepicker`. If you are looking for the outer DOM node (slds-dropdown-trigger), please review `triggerClassName`. _Tested with snapshot testing._

constrainToScrollParent.description: If true, constrains the menu to the scroll parent. Has no effect if `isInline` is `true`. _Not tested._

disabled.description: Disable input and calendar. _Tested with Mocha framework._

dateDisabled.description: This function callback receives a data object with a key of `date`. Write your own validation and return `true` if the date should be disabled, otherwise please return `false`. The value of `date` is the day rendered in the calendar with the current local time and timezone.

formatter.description: Date formatting function. _Tested with snapshot testing._

formattedValue.description: Value of input that gets passed to `parser` prop. Set the `value` prop if using a `Date` object. Use an external library such as [MomentJS](https://github.com/moment/moment/) if additional date formatting or internationalization is needed. _Not tested._

id.description: HTML id for component _Tested with snapshot testing._

isInline.description: Renders menu within the wrapping trigger as a sibling of the input. By default, you will have an absolutely positioned container at an elevated z-index.

type.name: custom
type.raw:
shape({
    abbreviatedWeekDays: PropTypes.array,
    label: PropTypes.string,
    months: PropTypes.array,
    placeholder: PropTypes.string,
    today: PropTypes.string,
    weekDays: PropTypes.array
})

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `abbreviatedWeekDays`: Three letter abbreviations of the days of the week, starting on Sunday. _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `months`: Names of the months. _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `label`: This label appears above the input.
* `placeholder`: Placeholder text for input. _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `today`: Label of shortcut to jump to today within the calendar. This is also used for assistive text on today's date. _Tested with snapshot testing._
* `weekDays`: Full names of the seven days of the week, starting on Sunday. _Tested with snapshot testing._

defaultValue.value:
{
    abbreviatedWeekDays: ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'],
    months: [
        'January',
        'February',
        'March',
        'April',
        'May',
        'June',
        'July',
        'August',
        'September',
        'October',
        'November',
        'December'
    ],
    placeholder: 'Pick a Date',
    today: 'Today',
    weekDays: [
        'Sunday',
        'Monday',
        'Tuesday',
        'Wednesday',
        'Thursday',
        'Friday',
        'Saturday'
    ]
}

isOpen.description: Forces the dropdown to be open or closed. See controlled/uncontrolled callback/prop pattern for more on suggested use view [Concepts and Best Practices](https://github.com/salesforce-ux/design-system-react/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#concepts-and-best-practices)

isIsoWeekday.description: Makes Monday the first day of the week. _Tested with snapshot testing._

onCalendarFocus.description: Triggered when the user wants to focus on a new day with the keyboard. If the target node is a day it will return the keyboard event a data object with the shape: `{date: [Date object]}`. Event will be `null` when new month is re-rendered.  _Tested with Mocha framework._

onChange.description: Triggered when the date changes. `onChange` can be used for form validation if needed. It receives an event and a data object in the shape: `{date: [Date object], formattedDate: [string], timezoneOffset: [number]}`. `data.date` is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), but the days of the calendar are in local time of the user. The `timezoneOffset` is the difference, in minutes, between UTC and the local time. Please note that this means that the offset is positive if the local timezone is behind UTC and negative if it is ahead. `timezoneOffset` is in minutes, for hours divide by `60`. _Tested with Mocha framework._

onClose.description: Triggered when the calendar is closed. _Tested with Mocha framework._

onOpen.description: Triggered when the calendar has opened. _Tested with Mocha framework._

onRequestClose.description: Function called when the calendar dialog would like hide. This will turn the calendar dialog into into a controlled component. Please use with `isOpen`. _Tested with Mocha framework._

onRequestOpen.description: Function called when the calendar dialog would like show. This will turn the calendar dialog into into a controlled component. Please use with `isOpen`. _Tested with Mocha framework._

parser.description: Custom function to parse date string into and return a `Date` object. Default function passes the input value to `Date()` and prays for a miracle. Use an external library such as [MomentJS](https://github.com/moment/moment/) if additional date parsing is needed. _Tested with snapshot testing._

relativeYearFrom.description: Offset of year from current year that can be selected in the year selection dropdown. (2017 - 5 = 2012). _Tested with snapshot testing._

relativeYearTo.description: Offset of year from current year that can be selected in the year selection dropdown. (2017 + 5 = 2012). _Tested with snapshot testing._

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `slds-datepicker-trigger`. This is typically a wrapping `div` around the input. _Tested with snapshot testing._

value.description: Sets date with a `Date` ECMAScript object. _Tested with snapshot testing._

icon.description: The Icon component is the Lightning Design System Icon component and should be used for naked icons. For icons that are buttons, use the Button component component with variant='icon'.

assistiveText.description: Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means. Naked icons must have assistive text, however, if you also have visible descriptive text with the icon, declare this prop as assistiveText=''.

className.description: CSS classes that are applied to the SVG.

icon.description: A custom SVG object to use instead of the supplied SLDS icons, look in `design-system-react/icons` for examples and syntax.

inverse.description: Setting `inverse` to true will switch the color of the icon: light to dark, dark to light.

name.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

path.description: Path to the icon. This will override any global icon settings

style.description: Custom styles to be passed to the SVG. Could be used to change icon or background color.

title.description: Title attribute for the icon container

filter.description: A Filter is a popover with custom trigger. It can be used by [Panel Filtering](/components/panels/). Menus within a Filter Popover will need to not have "portal mounts" and be inline.

align.description: Aligns the popover with the respective side of the trigger. That is `left` will place the `Popover` to the left of the Filter.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
* `removeFilter`: Assistive text for removing a filter. The default is `Remove Filter: this.props.property this.props.predicate`.
* `editFilter`: Assistive text for changing a filter.
* `editFilterHeading`: Assistive text for Popover heading.

children.description: Contents of popover. That is the dropdowns and inputs that set the filter criteria. **Dropdowns, Picklists and other menus must use `isInline` to work properly within a Popover due to existence of portal mounts in menus that are not inline.**

className.description: Custom CSS classes for `slds-filters__item` node. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

isError.description: Applies error state styling. Per filter error messages are outside this components.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button. An `id` will be generated if none is supplied.

isLocked.description: If true, the filter will not display an editing popover when clicked.

isPermanent.description: If true, the filter will not include a remove button.

onChange.description: Will be triggered when Done within the Popover is clicked. This is the place to update the filter props displayed. Callback will recieve parameters: `clickEvent, { id }`. An index into your store may be a good setting for `id`, so that it will be passed back here.

onRemove.description: Will be triggered when "Remove Filter" button is clicked. Callback will recieve parameters: `clickEvent, { id }`. An index into your store may be a good setting for `id`, so that it will be passed back here.

onClick.description: Will be triggered when Filter is clicked. This is the place to close/open popover if a custom popover is passed in

popover.description: A `Popover` component. The props from this popover will be merged and override any default props. This also allows a Filter's Popover dialog to be a controlled component. _Tested with Mocha framework._

predicate.description: The criteria you are filtering for. For instance, if "Hair Color is PURPLE" is your filter, "is PURPLE" is your filter predicate.

property.description: The property you are filtering. For instance, if "Hair Color is PURPLE" is your filter, "Hair Color" is your filter property.

input/inline.description: An inline input is rendered as a label by default. When clicked (or tabbed in), it's rendered as an input. When the focus is lost, the current input value is saved and the input is rendered as a label again.

className.description: Class names to be added to the outer container of the input.

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

disabled.description: Disables the Inline Edit component and prevents editing the contents.

id.description: Every Inline Edit component must have a unique ID in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support.

onChange.description: This event fires when the input changes.

type.description: Typically an Inline Edit component will be of the type text, but like the Input element it includes support for all HTML5 types.

value.description: Inline Edit is a controlled component, and will always display this value.

aria-controls.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the input with
another region of the page. An example would be a select box
that shows or hides a panel.

aria-owns.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the input with
another region of the page. An example would be a search field
that shows search results.

assistiveText.description:
If present, the label associated with this `input` is overwritten
by this text and is visually not shown.

className.description: Class names to be added to the outer container of the input.

disabled.description: Disables the input and prevents editing the contents.

errorText.description: Message to display when the input is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

iconLeft.description: Left aligned icon, must be instace of `design-system-react/components/icon/input-icon`

iconRight.description: Right aligned icon, must be instace of `design-system-react/components/icon/input-icon`

id.description: Every input must have a unique ID in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support.

inputRef.description: This callback exposes the input reference / DOM node to parent components. `<Parent inputRef={(inputComponent) => this.input = inputComponent} />

label.description: This label appears above the input.

onChange.description: This callback fires when the input changes. The synthetic React event will be the first parameter to the callback. You will probably want to reference `event.target.value` in your callback. No custom data object is provided.

onClick.description: This event fires when the input is clicked.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty input.

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

readOnly.description: Displays the value of the input statically. This follows the read only input UX pattern.

required.description: Highlights the input as a required field (does not perform any validation).

type.description: The `<Input>` element includes support for all HTML5 types.

value.description: The input is a controlled component, and will always display this value.

aria-controls.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the textarea with
another region of the page. An example would be a select box
that shows or hides a panel.

aria-owns.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the textarea with
another region of the page. An example would be a search field
that shows search results.

autoFocus.description: Specifies is the textarea should automatically get focus when the page loads.

assistiveText.description:
If present, the label associated with this `textarea` is overwritten
by this text and is visually not shown.

className.description: Class names to be added to the outer container of the textarea.

errorText.description: Message to display when the textarea is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

id.description: Every textarea must have a unique ID in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support.

textareaRef.description: This callback exposes the textarea reference / DOM node to parent components. `<Parent textareaRef={(textareaComponent) => this.textarea = textareaComponent} />

label.description: This label appears above the textarea.

onChange.description: This callback fires when the textarea changes. The synthetic React event will be the first parameter to the callback. You will probably want to reference `event.target.value` in your callback. No custom data object is provided.

onClick.description: This event fires when the textarea is clicked.

disabled.description: Disables the textarea and prevents editing the contents.

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty textarea.

required.description: Highlights the textarea as a required field (does not perform any validation).

value.description: The textarea is a controlled component, and will always display this value.

wrap.description: Specifies how the text in a text area is to be wrapped when submitted in a form.

global-header.description:
The global header is the anchor for the Salesforce platform and spans all other parts of the UI. It accepts children to define the items displayed within.

Example:
```
<SLDSGlobalHeader>
  <SLDSGlobalHeaderSearch />
  <SLDSGlobalHeaderButton />
  <SLDSGlobalHeaderDropdown />
  <SLDSGlobalHeaderDropdown />
  <SLDSGlobalHeaderProfile />
</SLDSGlobalHeader>
```

children.description: See the component description, this accepts some combination of `SLDSGlobalHeaderSearch`, `SLDSGlobalHeaderButton`, `SLDSGlobalHeaderDropdown`, and `SLDSGlobalHeaderProfile` components.

logoSrc.description: The Salesforce logo to display in the header.

navigation.description: Pass in the Global Navigation Bar component

onSkipToContent.description: Required for accessibility. Should jump the user to the primary content area.

onSkipToNav.description: Required for accessibility. Should jump the user to the primary navigation.

skipToContentAssistiveText.description: The localized text that will be read back for the "Skip to Main Content" accessibility link.

skipToNavAssistiveText.description: The localized text that will be read back for the "Skip to Navigation" accessibility link.

button.description: A helper component that renders a Button in the tools area of the Global Header. Currently defaults to a bare icon, but this can be overriden if text-based buttons are required.
button.name: button

dropdown.description: This component is an implementation of `MenuDropdown` with a custom trigger. All the properties listed below are provided to the `MenuDropdown` component. Any additional properties are provided to the Custom Trigger (that is the `Button` or `li` tag).

align.description: Aligns the right or left side of the menu with the respective side of the trigger. This is not intended for use with `nubbinPosition`.

className.description: Extra classnames to apply to the dropdown menu.

buttonClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to `li` element.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

iconVariant.description: For icon variants, please reference Lightning Design System Icons.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

globalAction.description: Adds custom styling such as inverse fill and special sizing/spacing

nubbinPosition.description: Positions dropdown menu with a nubbin--that is the arrow notch. The placement options correspond to the placement of the nubbin. This is implemeted with CSS classes and is best used with a `Button` with "icon container" styling. Dropdown menus will still be contained to the closest scrolling parent.

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dropdown menu in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item in the menu is clicked.

dropdown.name: dropdown

profile.description: A helper component that renders a MenuDropdown for the user profile.

align.description: Aligns the right or left side of the menu with the respective side of the trigger. This is not intended for use with `nubbinPosition`.

children.description:
By default, any children passed into this component will be rendered inside the dropdown menu. If you need custom content and a list, import 'design-system-react/components/utilities/menu-list/list' and pass in ``. ```
Look ma! This is Custom Content.
 ```

className.description: Extra classnames to apply to the dropdown menu.

avatar.description: An image URL to display for the user profile.

buttonClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to `li` element.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

nubbinPosition.description: Positions dropdown menu with a nubbin--that is the arrow notch. The placement options correspond to the placement of the nubbin. This is implemeted with CSS classes and is best used with a `Button` with "icon container" styling. Dropdown menus will still be contained to the closest scrolling parent.

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dropdown menu in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item in the menu is clicked.

profile.name: profile

search.description: The Global Header Search component is currently a Lookup. In the future this wrapper may provide additional presets or features.
search.name: search

global-navigation-bar.description: Global Navigation Bar represents a list of links that either take the user to another page or parts of the page the user is in.

children.description: The items to be displayed in the Global Navigation Bar.

className.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element.

cloud.description: Typically the cloud name (e.g.- "sales" or "marketing"). This primarily changes the background color.

theme.description: Transforms text and interactions (such as hover) to be more visually accessible.

button.description: A helper component that renders a Button as an item in the Global Navigation Bar. All props are passed onto `Button` except `active` and `dividerPosition`.

active.description: Whether the item is active or not.

button.name: button

dropdown.description: This component is an implementation of `MenuDropdown` with a custom trigger. All the properties listed below are provided to the `MenuDropdown` component. Any additional properties are provided to the Custom Trigger (that is the `Button` or `li` tag).

active.description: Whether the item is active or not.

activeBackgroundColor.description: Allows alignment of active item with active application background color.

assistiveText.description: Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means.

align.description: Aligns the right or left side of the menu with the respective side of the trigger. This is not intended for use with `nubbinPosition`.

className.description: Extra classnames to apply to the dropdown menu.

buttonClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to `li` element.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

length.description: Provided to List to indicate number of items visible in the List. Pass `null` to display all items, or a string containing one of the numeric option values listed under [Dropdown Height](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/menus/#flavor-dropdown-height) at the right (eg. '5').

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dropdown menu in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item in the menu is clicked.

dropdown.name: dropdown

label.description: Wraps text in the proper markup and removes link styling to support use in the GlobalNavigationBar.

className.description: Class names to be added to the `span` element

id.description: Id string applied to first <span> inside of <li>

label.name: label

link.description: Wraps a link in the proper markup to support use in the GlobalNavigationBar.

active.description: Whether the item is active or not.

activeBackgroundColor.description: Allows alignment of active item with active application background color. If application background is dark, text color may need to be `#fff`. This can be done with the style prop.

className.description: Class names to be added to the anchor element

href.description: The `href` attribute of the link. Please pass in bookmarkable URLs from your routing library. Use `GlobalNavigationBarButton` if a "real URL" is not desired. If the `onClick` callback is specified this URL will still be prevented from changing the browser's location.

id.description: The `id` attribute is applied to the `li` tag. _This was recently changed from being on the anchor tag._

label.description: Text to show for link item.

onClick.description: `function (event, href)` - fires when the link is clicked. If set, the browser location change to the `href` specified will be ignored, but the `href` will be included in an additional parameter passed to the callback.

tabIndex.description: Write "-1" if you don't want the user to tab to the button.

link.name: link

region.description: Regions make up a GlobalNavigation Bar and typically contain links and dropdowns. The Primary region contains the AppSwitcher, Application Name, and Object Switcher. The secondary region typically has navigation betweens sections of the application. The tertiary region is aligned to the right side of the screen and contains shortcuts or actions.

children.description: Contents of region. Expects `GlobalNavigationBarLink`, `GlobalNavigationBarDropdown`, `GlobalNavigationBarApplicationName`, `AppSwitcher`, but could be any component. This is the place to pass in an Object Switcher until that is supported.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the region

navigation.description: Wraps the `secondary` region in a `nav` and adds a role attribute

region.description: Region wrap children in styling specific to that region.

region.name: region

lookup.description:
Lookup is an advanced inline search form. The lookup can parse through single or multi scoped datasets. The parsed dataset can be filtered by single or multi option selects.

This component is wrapped in a [higher order component to listen for clicks outside itself](https://github.com/kentor/react-click-outside) and thus requires use of `ReactDOM`.

This component may use a portalMount (a disconnected React subtree mount) within an absolutely positioned DOM node created with [Drop](http://github.hubspot.com/drop/).

assistiveText.description:
If present, the label associated with this `input` is overwritten
by this text and is visually not shown.

className.description: Class names to be added to the tag classed with `slds-lookup`.

constrainToScrollParent.description: If true, constrains the menu to the scroll parent. Has no effect if `isInline` is `true`.

describedById.description: ID for aria-describedby (e.g. for an error message or a description)

disabled.description: This prop is passed onto the `input`. Prevents dropdown menu from opening. Also applies disabled styling to input.

emptyMessage.description: Custom message that renders when no matches found. The default empty state is just text that says, 'No matches found.'.

filterWith.description: Custom function to filter the Lookup items when typing into input field. The default function is case-insensitive and uses the searchTerm to filter Lookup items on their labels.

flippable.description: If true, the menu is constrained to the window and may be flipped up. Has no effect if `isInline` is `true`.

footerRenderer.description: Custom component for Lookup footer. The default footer allows user to add new item - see Lightning Design System Lookup > Base. To use the default footer, pass in Lookup.DefaultFooter.

headerRenderer.description: Custom component for Lookup header. The default header has a search icon and shows the search term - see Lightning Design System Lookup > Base. To use the default header, pass in Lookup.DefaultHeader.

iconCategory.description: Please refer to Lightning Design System Icons to view categories.

iconInverse.description: If true, icon color is white. If false, icon color is the default text color.

iconName.description: Name of icon. Please refer to Lightning Design System Icons to view icon names.

iconPosition.description: Determines whether the input's icon will display that icon on the left or the right.

isInline.description: Renders menu within the wrapping trigger as a sibling of the button. By default, you will have an absolutely positioned container at an elevated z-index.

listItemLabelRenderer.description: Custom component that overrides the default Lookup Item component.

onBlur.description: Triggered when input focus is removed.

onChange.description: Triggered when the contents of the input changes.

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item is selected from the dropdown menu.

onUnselect.description: Triggered when an item is an item is removed from the input.

options.description: Item added to the dropdown menu.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty input.

required.description: If true, adds asterisk next to input label to indicate it is a required field.

searchTerm.description: Text passed on to header search input of dropdown menu.

sectionDividerRenderer.description: Custom component that overrides the default section divider

selectedItem.description: Index of current selected item. To clear the selection, pass in -1.

media-object.description: When you need text and a figure next to each other, use a media object.

canTruncate.description: Often the body may need to be truncated for correct layout. This is only applicable if using the component within a flexbox container.

className.description: Class names to be added to the component's HTML tag with `slds-media` class.

body.description: The body is often text such as a heading or paragraph.

figure.description: The figure is the optional visualization of the text within the body.

verticalCenter.description: Vertically centers the body with the middle of the figure.

menu-dropdown.description:
The MenuDropdown component is a variant of the Lightning Design System Menu component. This component
may require a polyfill such as [classList](https://github.com/yola/classlist-polyfill) due to
[react-onclickoutside](https://github.com/Pomax/react-onclickoutside) if Internet Explorer 11
support is needed.

This component is wrapped in a [higher order component to listen for clicks outside itself](https://github.com/kentor/react-click-outside) and thus requires use of `ReactDOM`.

This component may use a portalMount (a disconnected React subtree mount) within an absolutely positioned DOM node created with [Drop](http://github.hubspot.com/drop/).

align.description: Aligns the right or left side of the menu with the respective side of the trigger. This is not intended for use with `nubbinPosition`.

assistiveText.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means. You can omit this prop if you are using the `label` prop.

buttonClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to triggering button.

buttonInverse.description: If true, button/icon is white. Meant for buttons or utility icons on dark backgrounds.

buttonVariant.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Determines variant of the Button component that triggers dropdown.

checkmark.description: If true, renders checkmark icon on the selected Menu Item.

children.description: By default, any children passed into this component will be rendered inside the dropdown menu. If you need custom content and a list, import 'design-system-react/components/menu-list/list' and pass in ``. If you need to modify the trigger button, import the module `design-system-react/dropdown/button-trigger` and render a grandchild of the element type `Button`. Any `props` specified on that `Button` will be assigned to the trigger button. Any `id` prop or event hanlders (`onBlur`, `onClick`, etc.) set on the button grandchild will be overwritten by `MenuDropdown` to enable functionality and accessibility. A custom trigger child will not be considered content for the dropdown menu. ```

className.description: CSS classes to be added to dropdown menu.

containerClassName.description: By default, these class names will be added to the absolutely-positioned `Dialog` component.

disabled.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Prevent dropdown menu from opening. Also applies disabled styling to trigger button.

hint.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Associates an icon button with another element on the page by changes the color of the SVG. Please reference Lightning Design System Buttons > Hint.

hoverCloseDelay.description: Delay on menu closing in milliseconds.

iconCategory.description: Name of the icon category. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon categories.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

iconPosition.description: If omitted, icon position is centered.

iconVariant.description: For icon variants, please reference Lightning Design System Icons.

iconSize.description: Determines the size of the icon.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

isInline.description: Renders menu within the wrapping trigger as a sibling of the button. By default, you will have an absolutely positioned container at an elevated z-index.

isOpen.description: Forces the dropdown to be open or closed. See controlled/uncontrolled callback/prop pattern for more on suggested use view [Concepts and Best Practices](https://github.com/salesforce-ux/design-system-react/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#concepts-and-best-practices)

label.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Text within the trigger button.

listItemRenderer.description: Custom element that overrides the default Menu Item component.

length.description: This prop is passed into the List for the menu. Pass null to make it the size of the content, or a string with an integer from here: https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/menus/#flavor-dropdown-height

menuStyle.description: Style applied to menu element (that is the `.slds-dropdown` element)

nubbinPosition.description: Positions dropdown menu with a nubbin--that is the arrow notch. The placement options correspond to the placement of the nubbin. This is implemeted with CSS classes and is best used with a `Button` with "icon container" styling (`iconVariant="container"`). Use with `isInline` prop, since positioning is determined by CSS via absolute-relative positioning, and using an absolutely positioned menu will not position the menu correctly without manual offsets.

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dropdown menu in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onBlur.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button loses focus.

onClick.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked.

onFocus.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button gains focus.

openOn.description: Determines if mouse hover or click opens or closes the dropdown menu. The default of `click` opens the menu on click, touch, or keyboard navigation and is highly recommended to comply with accessibility standards. The other options are `hover` which opens when the mouse enters the focusable area, and `hybrid` which causes the menu to open on clicking of the trigger, but closes the menu when the mouse leaves the menu and trigger area. If you are planning on using `hover` or `hybrid`, please pause a moment and reconsider.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onMouseEnter.description: Called when mouse hovers over the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onMouseLeave.description: Called when mouse hover leaves the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item in the menu is clicked.

onOpen.description: Triggered when the dropdown is opened.

onClose.description: Triggered when the dropdown is closed.

style.description: An object of CSS styles that are applied to the triggering button.

overlay.description: If `true`, adds a transparent overlay when the menu is open to handle outside clicks. Allows clicks on iframes to be captured, but also forces a double-click to interact with other elements. If a function is passed, custom overlay logic may be defined by the app.

tooltip.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. It creates a tooltip with the content of the `node` provided.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

multiple.description: Whether this dropdown supports multi select.

button-trigger.description: The Dropdown Button Trigger renders the default trigger button for the dropdown menu. If this component has children, it does not render itself to the DOM. Instead, it renders its child element, `Button`, and all that child's properties. This component may be used as a template to create custom triggers that do not use `Button`.

children.description:
Import the module `design-system-react/dropdown/button-trigger` and render a grandchild of the element type `Button`. Any `props` specified on that `Button` will be assigned to the triggering button. Any `id` prop or event hanlders (`onBlur`, `onClick`, etc.) set on the button grandchild will be overwritten by `MenuDropdown` to allow functionality and accessibility.
```
<Dropdown>
  <Trigger>
    <Button iconCategory="utility" iconName="settings" />
  </Trigger>
</Dropdown>
```

className.description: CSS classes to be added to triggering button.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button. This is provided by the `MenuDropdown`. Please use `MenuDropdown` to set.

isInline.description: Renders menu within the wrapping trigger as a sibling of the button. By default, you will have an absolutely positioned container at an elevated z-index.

isOpen.description: Informs the trigger on the open/close state of the dropdown menu

menu.description: By Default the dropdown menu is inside a `Dialog` component.

onBlur.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button loses focus.

onClick.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked.

onFocus.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button gains focus.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onMouseEnter.description: Called when mouse hovers over the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onMouseLeave.description: Called when mouse hover leaves the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

openOn.description: Determines if mouse hover or click opens the dropdown menu. The default of `click` is highly recommended to comply with accessibility standards. If you are planning on using hover, please pause a moment and reconsider.

triggerRef.description: The ref of the actual triggering button.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

button-trigger.name: button-trigger

menu-picklist.description: The MenuPicklist component is a variant of the Lightning Design System Menu component.

buttonRef.description: Callback that passes in the DOM reference of the `<button>` DOM node within this component. Primary use is to allow `focus` to be called. You should still test if the node exists, since rendering is asynchronous. `buttonRef={(component) => { if(component) console.log(component); }}`

checkmark.description: If true, renders checkmark icon on the selected Menu Item.

errorText.description: Message to display when the input is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

isInline.description: Renders menu within the wrapping trigger as a sibling of the button. By default, you will have an absolutely positioned container at an elevated z-index.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `multipleOptionsSelected`: Text to be used when multiple items are selected. "2 Options Selected" is a good pattern to use.

listItemRenderer.description: Custom element that overrides the default Menu Item component.

multiple.description: Allows multiple items to be selected. Items will be shown in pills. Clicking the item does not close the menu.

onClick.description: Triggered when the trigger button is clicked to open.

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item is selected. Passes in the option object that has been selected and a data object in the format: `{ option, optionIndex }`. The first parameter may be deprecated in the future and changed to an event for consistency. Please use the data object.

placeholder.description: Text present in trigger button if no items are selected.

required.description: Add styling of a required form element.

modal.description: The Modal component is used for the Lightning Design System Modal and Notification > Prompt components. The Modal opens from a state change outside of the component itself (pass this state to the isOpen prop). For more details on the Prompt markup, please review the Notifications > Prompt. By default, `Modal` will add `aria-hidden=true` to the `body` tag, but this disables some assistive technologies. To prevent this you can add the following to your application with `#mount` being the root node of your application that you would like to hide from assistive technologies when the `Modal` is open. ``` import settings from 'design-system-react/components/settings'; settings.setAppElement('#mount'); ``` This component uses a portalMount (a disconnected React subtree mount) to create a modal as a child of `body`.

children.description: Modal content.

closeButtonAssistiveText.description: Text read aloud by screen readers when the user focuses on the Close Button.

containerClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal's container. This is the element with `.slds-modal__container`. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

contentClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal's body. This is the element that has overflow rules and should be used to set a static height if desired. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

contentStyle.description: Custom styles for the modal's body. This is the element that has overflow rules and should be used to set a static height if desired.

directional.description: If true, modal footer buttons render left and right. An example use case would be for "back" and "next" buttons.

dismissible.description: If true, Modals can be dismissed by clicking on the close icon or pressing esc key.

dismissOnClickOutside.description: If true, Modals can be dismissed by clicking outside of modal. If unspecified, defaults to dismissible.

onRequestClose.description: Callback to fire with Modal is dismissed

footer.description: Accepts either a node or array of buttons to be placed in the footer. If array, the buttons render on the right side by default but are floated left and right if directional is true.

header.description: Allows for a custom modal header that does not scroll with modal content. If this is defined, `title` and `tagline` will be ignored. The close button will still be present.

headerClassName.description: Adds CSS classes to the container surrounding the modal header and the close button. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

isOpen.description: Forces the modal to be open or closed.

parentSelector.description: Function that returns parent node to contain Modal. Should return document.querySelector('#myModalContainer').

portalClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the portal DOM node. This node is a direct descendant of the `body` and is the parent of `ReactModal__Overlay`. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

prompt.description: Styles the modal as a prompt.

size.description: Specifiies the modal's width. May be deprecated in favor of `width` in the future.

tagline.description: Content underneath the title in the modal header.

title.description: Text heading at the top of a modal.

toast.description: Allows adding additional notifications within the modal.

navigation.description: Navigation represents a list of links that either take the user to another page or parts of the page the user is in.

id.description: HTML id for component. _Tested with snapshot testing._

className.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element. _Tested with snapshot testing._

categories.description: Array of categories. The required shape is: `{id: string, label: string, items: array}`. The required shape of an item is `{id: string, label: string, url: string}`. All item ids are expected to be unique. _Tested with snapshot testing._

selectedId.description: The ID of the item that is currently selected. Defaults to the ID of the first item. _Tested with Mocha framework._

onSelect.description: Triggered when the selection changes. It receives an event and an item object in the shape: `event, {item: [object] }`. _Tested with Mocha framework._

variant.description: Determines component style. _Tested with snapshot testing._

notification.description: The Notification component is the Alert and Toast variants of the Lightning Design System Notification component. For prompt notifications, use the Modal component with prompt={true}. The Notification opens from a state change outside of the component itself (pass this state to the isOpen prop).

className.description: Custom classes applied to Notification element.

dismissible.description: If true, close button appears for users to dismiss Notification.

duration.description: If duration exists, the Notification will disappear after that amount of time.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lighning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

theme.description: Styling for Notification background color. Please reference Lighning Design System Themes > Color.

panel.description: A panel provides detailed contextual information or contextual filtering options. [Filter](/components/filters/) component should be used as children. Menus within a Filter Popover will need to not have "portal mounts" and be inline.

children.description: The contents of the panel

filtering/group.description: A filtering panel contextual filtering options.

addFilterLabel.description: Localized description of the "Add Filter" button in the footer

assistiveTextCloseFilterPanel.description: Localized description of the close button for the panel for screen readers

cancelLabel.description: Label for button that cancels modified filters

children.description:
Pass in `FilterList`'s of `Filters`:

```
<FilterGroup
  variant="panel"
>
  <FilterList>
    <Filter
      property="Show Me"
      predicate="All Wackamoles"
    >
    {popoverContents}
    </Filter>
  </FilterList>
</FilterGroup>
```

errorLabel.description: Label for the error message at the top of the panel.

footer.description: Allows for customization of footer. This will be added after any `FilterList`'s in the DOM. If using Panel Filter Group outside of a panel, do not set the variant to `panel` and header and footer will be removed.

header.description: Allows for customization of header. This will be added before any `FilterList`'s in the DOM. If using Panel Filter Group outside of a panel, do not set the variant to `panel` and header and footer will be removed.

heading.description: The heading within the header of the filtering panel

modified.description: Shows confirmation heading. Please see `onRequestCancel` and `onRequestSave`.

onClickAdd.description: Callback triggered when "Add Filter" is clicked. Recieves an `event`.

onClickRemoveAll.description: Callback triggered when "Remove All" is clicked. Recieves an `event`.

onRequestCancel.description: When the panel's cancel button is clicked in order to reset filter panel to previous state.

onRequestClose.description: When the panel's close button is clicked. Please place Panel within another element to control position and visibility.

onRequestSave.description: When the panel's save button is clicked in order to confirm filter panel state.

removeAllLabel.description: Localized description of the "Remove All" button in the footer

saveLabel.description: Label for button that saves modified filters

variant.description: Adds in default Panel header and footer

filtering/group.name: filtering/group

filtering/list-heading.description: A filtering panel contextual filtering options.

isLocked.description: Displayed a heading for a locked list of filters

lockedHeading.description: Heading for a group of filters that are locked

filtering/list-heading.name: filtering/list-heading

filtering/list.description: A list of Filters. This is a higher order component for filters that decorates the filter to work within a Filtering Panel. It also adds support for a Filter error label.
filtering/list.name: filtering/list

popover.description: The Popover component is a non-modal dialog. It should be paired with a clickable trigger such as a `Button`. It traps focus from the page and must be exited if focus needs to be outside the Popover. Use a `Tooltip` if there are no call to actions within the dialog. A `Tooltip` does not need to be clicked.

align.description: Aligns the popover with the respective side of the trigger. That is `top` will place the `Popover` above the trigger.

ariaLabelledby.description: HTML `id` of heading for popover. Only use if your header is within your popover body.

children.description: The trigger of the component. This must be a **single node**. Many props will be passed into this trigger related to popover interactions. The child needs to be a clickable element, such as a `Button` or an anchor tag (`a`).

body.description: The contents of the popover. This should also accept arrays.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the popover. That is the element with `.slds-popover` on it.

disabled.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Prevent popover from opening. Also applies disabled styling to trigger button.

id.description: By default, a unique ID will be created at render to support keyboard navigation, ARIA roles, and connect the popover to the triggering button. This ID will be applied to the triggering element. `${id}-popover`, `${id}-dialog-heading`, `${id}-dialog-body` are also created.

isOpen.description: Forces the popover to be open or closed. See controlled/uncontrolled callback/prop pattern for more on suggested use [](https://github.com/salesforce-ux/design-system-react/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#concepts-and-best-practices) You will want this if Popover is to be a controlled component.

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dialog in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onClick.description: This function is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked. You will want this if Popover is to be a controlled component.

onClose.description: This function is triggered when the dialog is closed. This occurs when the Dialog child component (that is the actual popover) is unmounted and removed from the DOM. This function returns `{event, { trigger, componentWillUnmount }`. Trigger can have the values `cancel`, `clickOutside`, or `newPopover`.

onKeyDown.description: Called when a key is pressed.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onOpen.description: This function is triggered when the Dialog child component (that is the actual popover) is mounted and added to the DOM. The parameters are `event, { portal: }`. `portal` can be used as a React tree root node.

onRequestClose.description: This function is triggered when the user clicks outside the Popover or clicks the close button. You will want to define this if Popover is to be a controlled component. Most of the time you will want wnat to set `isOpen` to `false` when this is triggered unless you need to validate something.

style.description: An object of CSS styles that are applied to the `slds-popover` DOM element.

overlay.description: If `true`, adds a transparent overlay when the menu is open to handle outside clicks. Allows clicks on iframes to be captured, but also forces a double-click to interact with other elements. If a function is passed, custom overlay logic may be defined by the app.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

page-header.description: The PageHeader component adds PageHeader, PageHeader.Info, PageHeader.Title, PageHeader.DetailRow, and PageHeader.DetailBlock.

className.description: Optional class name

label.description: The info property can be a string or a React element

title.description: The title property can be a string or a React element

info.description: The info property can be a string or a React element

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

iconPosition.description: If omitted, icon position is centered.

iconVariant.description: For icon variants, please reference Lightning Design System Icons.

contentRight.description: Content to appear on the right hand side of the page header

details.description: An array of buttons which appear on the component's right hand side.

navRight.description: Nav content which appears in the upper right hand corner.

trail.description: An array of react elements presumably anchor <a> elements.

progress-indicator.description: Progress Indicator is a component that communicates to the user the progress of a particular process.

methods.name: getId
methods.docblock: Get the progress indicator's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.
methods.description: Get the progress indicator's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `percentage`: Label for Progress Bar. The default is `Progress: ${this.props.value}%`

className.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element. `array`, `object`, or `string` are accepted.

completedSteps.description: Stores all completed steps. It is an array of step objects.

disabledSteps.description:
Stores all disabled steps. It is an array of step objects. Steps are still clickable/focusable,
this only disables cursor change and removes onClick and onFocus event callbacks.

errorSteps.description: Stores all error steps. It is an array of step objects and usually there is only one error step, the current step.

id.description: HTML id for component.

selectedStep.description: Represents the currently selected or active step. It is a step object.

steps.description:
Determines the behaviors of step buttons
It is an array of JSON objects in the following form:
 [{
	id: <PropTypes.number> or <PropTypes.string>, has to be unique
	label: <PropTypes.string>, representing the tooltip content
	assistiveText: <PropTypes.string>, The default is `Step ${props.index + 1}: ${status}`. Status is if the step has been completed or in an error state.
 }],

tooltipIsOpenSteps.description: Stores all steps with opened tooltips. This property is mainly for development purposes. The tooltip should only show on hover for the user.

tooltip.description: The PopoverTooltip component is variant of the Lightning Design System Popover component. This component wraps an element that triggers it to open. It must be a focusable child element (either a button or an anchor), so that keyboard users can navigate to it.

align.description: Alignment of the Tooltip relative to the element that triggers it.

children.description: Pass the one element that triggers the Tooltip as a child. It must be an element with `tabIndex` or an element that already has a `tabIndex` set such as an anchor or a button, so that keyboard users can tab to it.

flippable.description: Constrains tooltip to window. If the tooltip is near the bottom, then it may appear about the trigger, despite the value of `align`.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the popover to the triggering element.

isOpen.description: Forces tooltip to be open. A value of `false` will disable any interaction with the tooltip.

target.description: This sets the location of the tooltip, if that location is different from the triggering node.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `slds-tooltip-trigger`.

triggerStyle.description: Custom styles to be added to wrapping triggering `div`.

variant.description: Determines the variant of tooltip: for informative purpose (blue background) or warning purpose (red background)

methods.name: isTabFromContainer
methods.docblock:
Determine if a node from event.target is a Tab element for the current Tabs container.
If the clicked element is not a Tab, it returns false.
If it finds another Tabs container between the Tab and `this`, it returns false.
methods.description:
Determine if a node from event.target is a Tab element for the current Tabs container.
If the clicked element is not a Tab, it returns false.
If it finds another Tabs container between the Tab and `this`, it returns false.

id.description: HTML `id` attribute of primary element that has `.slds-tabs--default` on it. Optional: If one is not supplied, a `shortid` will be created.

children.description:
The `children` are the actual tabs and panels to be displayed. Note that the structure of the `` component **does not** correspond to the DOM structure that is rendered. The `` component requires one or more children of type ``, which themselves require a `label` property which will be what shows in the `` and has `children`, which end up being the _contents of the tab's corresponding panel_. The component iterates through each `` and rendering one `` and one `` for each of them. The tab(s) end up being children of the ``. ```

This is my tab 1 contents!

They show when you click the first tab.

This is my tab 2 contents!

They show when you click the second tab.

 ```

className.description: Class names to be added to the container element and is passed along to its children.

defaultSelectedIndex.description: The Tab (and corresponding TabPanel) that is selected when the component first renders. Defaults to `0`.

onSelect.description: This function triggers when a tab is selected.

variant.description: If the Tabs should be scopped, defaults to false

selectedIndex.description: The Tab (and corresponding TabPanel) that is currently selected.

label.description: The string or element that is handed off to the `<Tab />` component, ends up being the title and the label for the tab associated with its tab panel.

children.description:
The `children` are the actual tab panels to be rendered. They get created by [tabs/index.jsx](./index.jsx) in the `renderTabPanels` function.

Note that the `<TabsPanel />` component inserts a `div` element around the children, because React requires exactly one "parent" element returned. The `<TabPanel />` component simply dips down into `children` to get the children of this wrapping `div` so that it does not get rendered in the DOM.

tree.description: A tree is visualization of a structure hierarchy. A branch can be expanded or collapsed. This is a controlled component, since visual state is present in the `nodes` data.

assistiveText.description: For users of assistive technology, if set the heading will be hidden. One of `heading` or `assistiveText` must be set in order to label the tree.

className.description: Class names to be added to the container element which has the heading and the `ul.slds-tree` element as children.

listClassName.description: Class names to be added to the top-level `ul` element of the tree.

getNodes.description: A function that will be called by every branch to receive its child nodes. The parent `node` object with the branch data is passed into this function: `getNodes(node)`. If your state engine is Flux or Redux, then your tree data structure will probably be flattened or normalized within the store. This will allow you to build out your tree without transversing an actual tree of data and may be more performant.

heading.description: This is the tree's heading and describes its contents. It can be hidden, see `assistiveText`.

id.description: HTML `id` of primary element that has `.slds-tree` on it. This component has a wrapping container element outside of `.slds-tree`.

nodes.description: Array of items starting at the top of the tree. The required shape is: `{expanded: string, id: string, label: string, selected: string, type: string, nodes: array}`, but only `id` and `label` are required. Use `type: 'branch'` for folder and categories.

onClick.description: Function that will run whenever an item or branch is clicked.

onExpandClick.description: This function triggers when the expand or collapse icon is clicked.

onScroll.description: This function triggers when the top-level `ul` element scrolls. This can be used to implement an "infinite scroll" pattern and update the `nodes` prop accordingly.

searchTerm.description: Highlights term if found in node label. This does not auto-expand branches.

disabled.description: Disables the input and prevents editing the contents.

isInline.description: Renders menu within the wrapping trigger as a sibling of the button. By default, you will have an absolutely positioned container at an elevated z-index.

label.description: This label appears above the input.

listItemRenderer.description: Custom element that overrides the default Menu Item component.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty input.

required.description: If true, adds asterisk next to input label to indicate it is a required field.
